channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sunken manhole cover, 3rd June
item.description:
Manhole cover near telegraph pole causing damage to wheels/tyres. This road had previously been marked about a year ago, possibly for resurfacing(?), but still in bad state, & this damaged manhole is causing an issue for quite sometime.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken manhole cover potential vehicle damage, 3rd June
item.description:
Hi. This has been reported previously, it is a sunken manhole cover that is a big dip in the side of the road before a blind bend. Motorists move to center of the road (coming from the M5 bridge) to avoid vehicle tyre/suspension damage, this is also quite dangerous as it is a fast road. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree bearing on open reach/internet cable causing loud vibrating noise, 3rd June
item.description:
Tree outside 29 Keynsham Road, GL53 7PU. Tree branches are bearing onto the open reach cable that runs across the street. When it is windy this puts pressure on the cable and causes it to vibrate very loud.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Keynsham Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: When will the 2 trees marked with irange in Broadclose Road be felled supnce they are causing obstructions of pipes below ground on the A38 and also on Broadclose Road?, 2nd June
item.description:
I wish to know when the trees marked for felling will be felled.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A38, Down Hatherley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: EV’s no longer able to charge vehicle due to signage, 2nd June
item.description:
The EV chargers can no longer be used due to the changed signage for “electric vehicle charging/permit holders” - taking away EV charging points that permit holders don’t use & park non-EV cars & vans. Cheltenham town centre is a desert when it comes to EV chargers without changing the ones that do exist to permit holders only, when local permit holders have no use for them. I have already witnessed an MG electric vehicle, plugged in being charged with a traffic wardens parking ticket fixed on the windscreen, not sure how many others. Please can these places be monitored with the look at changing these EV charging spots for use by All EV users as current policy is so anti-EV.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99, Sheldons Court, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Traffic light need upgradning, 2nd June
item.description:
Traffic lights junction B4063 with Greyhound Gardens/ Nnine Elms Road. This needs a designated Right Turn traffic lights when B4063 straight ahead traffic is held at a Red Stop signal. At peak times queuing Right Turn traffic for Greyhound Gardens causes a tail back on the B4063 which then blocks Elmbridge Court RAB which affects all the major roads. This issue has been present for years but the recent cycle lane construction works has increased the problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: The traffic light has been vandalised

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 2nd June
item.description:

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 2nd June
item.description:
Customer reports that all of works at the location are complete - the holes are filled - but the lane closures and temp TS remain in place. They request that the TM is removed as it is causing chaos and holding up traffic/buses unnecessarily.
Report on FixMyStreet
